data.name: Cmd_CustomCommand_Command_Description
data.value: An application-defined command flag that indicates which custom command to execute. The value must be between 128 and 256, inclusive.

data.name: Cmd_CustomCommand_Description
data.value: Executes the custom command number, e.g. command 135.

data.name: Cmd_Description
data.value: No description is available for the command in the current language.

data.name: Cmd_Disconnect_Description
data.value: Disconnect from the service without shutting it down. If running in interactive console mode, consider using the Shutdown if you wish the service to cleanly exit.

data.name: Cmd_Help_Command_Description
data.value: The name of the command to get help for. If omitted, all commands will be listed.

data.name: Cmd_Help_Parameter_Description
data.value: The name of the parameter to get help for. If omitted, all parameters of the command will be listed.

data.name: Cmd_Install_Description
data.value: Installs the running service as a windows service.

data.name: Cmd_Install_Password_Description
data.value: The optional password for the account the service is to run under. An incorrect password will prevent the service from starting.

data.name: Cmd_Install_UserName_Description
data.value: The optional username for the service to run under (note must have enough permission to interact with local performance counters and filesystem). Use form "DomainName\UserName", e.g. "NT AUTHORITY\LocalService" for local service account; "NT AUTHORITY\NetworkService" for network service account; "NT Service\ServiceName" to use a virtual account; or ".\UserName" to use a local account. The default is to use the LocalSystem account, but this doesn't normally have the required permissions and so the service will fail to start.

data.name: Cmd_Param_Description
data.value: No description is available for the parameter in the current language.

data.name: Cmd_Performance_Category_Description
data.value: The name of the performance counter to get the details of. If omitted, all performance counters will be listed.

data.name: Cmd_Performance_Description
data.value: Displays the performance counters for this service.

data.name: Cmd_PowerEvent_Description
data.value: Sends the power status to the service, e.g. power Suspend.

data.name: Cmd_PowerEvent_PowerStatus_Description
data.value: The power status to send to the service. This is only available in interactive mode.

data.name: Cmd_SessionChange_ChangeReason_Description
data.value: The reason for the change notice.

data.name: Cmd_SessionChange_Description
data.value: Sends a session changed notice to the service, e.g session SessionLogon 0

data.name: Cmd_Shutdown_Description
data.value: Shuts down the service and quits. This is only available in interactive mode.

data.name: Cmd_Start_Description
data.value: Starts the service, passing in the specified arguments, e.g. start arg1 arg2 arg3.

data.name: Cmd_Uninstall_Description
data.value: Uninstalls the running service as a windows service.

data.name: Err_BaseService_CouldNotLocateAssemblyGuid
data.value: The '{0}' does not define a GuidAttribute, so creating a random one. Add a GuidAttribute to prevent multiple instances of the service being started.

data.name: Err_BaseService_Failed_To_Acquire_WaitHandle
data.value: Another instance of the service is running so this instance cannot be started.

data.name: Err_Install_Requires_Administrator
data.value: Service installation requires running as an administrator.

data.name: Err_NamedPipeConnection_Failed
data.value: A fatal error occurred on the current named pipe connection, closing.

data.name: Err_NamedPipeServer_CannotGetCurrentOwner
data.value: Cannot get the current security identity for securing a named pipe, so aborting.

data.name: Err_NamedPipeServer_Fatal_Error_Securing
data.value: A fatal error occurred trying to secure the named pipe server.

data.name: Err_NamedPipeServer_PipeAlreadyExists
data.value: The '{0}' named pipe already exists on the server, and so cannot be created!

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_IDParameterWrongType
data.value: ID parameter should be of type Guid, but was actually of type '{0}'

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_Invalid_Command_Method
data.value: Invalid command method '{0}'. A service runner command with ConsumeLine set must declare exactly one string parameter.

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_Parameter_Conversion_Unsupported
data.value: Cannot convert string to '{0}' for parameter '{1}' on method '{2}'.

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_IDParameterMissing
data.value: The ID parameter '{0}' expected but not found in method '{1}'.

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_WriterParameterWrongType
data.value: Writer parameter should be of type TextWriter, but was actually of type '{0}'

data.name: Err_ServiceRunner_Pause_ServiceNotRunning
data.value: The '{0}' service is not running, so cannot be paused!

data.name: Err_ServiceRunner_Stop_ServiceNotRunning
data.value: The '{0}' service is not running, so cannot be stopped!

data.name: Err_Uninstall_Requires_Administrator
data.value: Service removal requires running as an administrator.

data.name: Err_Unknown_Command
data.value: The '{0}' command is not supported by the service.

data.name: Inf_BaseService_RunAsync_NotRunningAsAdmin
data.value: The service is not running as an administrator, some functionality will be disabled.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_CustomCommand_Complete
data.value: Running '{0}' custom command on service '{1}' took {2}ms.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_Installed
data.value: Installed the '{0}' service from the '{1}' path.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_PowerEvent_Sending
data.value: Sending the '{0}' power event to service '{1}'.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_PowerEvent_Sent
data.value: Sending the '{0}' power event to service '{1}' returned '{2}'.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_SessionChange_Sending
data.value: Sending the '{0}' session change event for session '{1}' to service '{2}'.

data.name: Inf_ServiceRunner_SessionChange_Sent
data.value: Sent the '{0}' session change event for session '{1}' to service '{2}'.

data.name: Not_NamedPipeConnection_Connection
data.value: The service received a connection from '{0}'.

data.name: Wrn_BaseService_EventHandlerAlreadyExists
data.value: Another instance of the service may be running, so starting or stopping the service may fail.

data.name: Wrn_Command_Alias_Already_Used_By_Other_Command
data.value: The '{0}' command alias for '{1}' is already used by the '{2}' command.

data.name: Wrn_Command_Invalid_Generic
data.value: The '{0}' method cannot implement a service runner command as it is generic.

data.name: Wrn_No_Description_For_Command
data.value: No description was specified for the '{0}' command.

data.name: Wrn_No_Description_For_Parameter
data.value: No description was specified for the '{0}' parameter in the '{1}' command.

data.name: Wrn_No_Names_For_Command
data.value: No names were found for the '{0}' command.

data.name: Wrn_ServiceCommand_Creation_Failed
data.value: Failed to create a service runner command for the '{0}' method

data.name: ConsoleConnection_RunAsync_WaitInstall
data.value: Waiting for service to be detected...

data.name: ConsoleConnection_RunAsync_WaitUninstall
data.value: Waiting for service removal to be detected...

data.name: ConsoleConnection_RunAsync_RunningNonInteractive
data.value: Running service in non-interactive mode (use CTRL-C to kill).

data.name: ConsoleConnection_RunAsync_RunningNonInteractive2
data.value: To control, connect using a service client.

data.name: Err_ServiceCommand_CancellationTokenParameterWrongType
data.value: Cancellation token parameter should be of type CancellationToken, but was actually of type '{0}'

data.name: ConsoleConnection_RunAsync_OptionRunCmdNewCredentials
data.value: Run service from command line under new credentials.

data.name: Commands_AllCommandsHelpFormat
Commands_CommandHelpFormat
Commands_ParameterHelpFormat
Command_AllPerformanceCategoriesFormat
Command_Help_CommandParameterNotFoundFormat
data.value: {!fgcolor:Red}The parameter '{ParamName}' does not exist on the '{CommandName}' command.

data.name: BaseService_Install_vshostProcess
data.value: Process running in vshost, using '{0}' instead.
